Description.val:
[P5 / NU019 EPLRS-DR/EMUT]: Enhanced Position Location Reporting System - Data Radio (EPLRS-DR)/Enhanced Man-Pack UHF Tactical (EMUT) is a Blue in Support of Green (BISOG) program that provides secure Anti-Jam (AJ), Ultra High Frequency (UHF) (420-450 MHz) and Line of Sight (LOS) data communications in support of amphibious operations at throughputs of up to 54Kbps. EPLRS-DR provides embedded Position Location Information (PLI) between shipboard networks and the shore-based Marine Tactical Data Network (TDN) and the Army Tactical Internet (TI). To meet a National Security Agency (NSA) mandate, KOK13 cryptographic equipment was replaced with KOK23/CKG cryptographic equipment. EPLRs and EMUT efforts will include antenna upgrades. EPLRS-DR will also include Landing Force Iridium infrastructure.

[P5 / NU790 Navy Expeditionary C4I]: Navy Expeditionary Command, Control, Communications, Computers, & Intelligence (C4I): Provides procurement and integration for outfitting Table of Allowance (TOA) buy lists within the Expeditionary forces.  Ensures common C4I solutions are being coordinated, tracked, procured and integrated across Navy Expeditionary Combat Command (NECC) forces. The increase in funding reflects establishment, approval and funding of NSW service-common Table Of Allowance to begin correcting shortfalls and bring NSW forces into alignment with required outfitting standards in accordance with SOCOM-USN Memorandum of Agreement.

[P5 / NU239 PORT NSW]: NU239 - PORT NSW: The FY20 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts. 

Portable Radio/Naval Special Warfare (PORT NSW) tactical radio:  PORT NSW procures hand held and man pack/vehicular radios for NSW.  Procurement needed to support Force Protection operations, especially with joint forces.  NSW operational elements (SEAL platoons and Combatant Craft Detachments) rely on tactical communications and electronics equipment to accomplish all missions assigned in support of the Joint and Fleet commanders.  Navy resourced tactical communications equipment is considered mission essential and will be employed by individual SEAL personnel and NSW combat elements in man pack configurations as well as onboard tactical vehicles and NSW combatant craft in tactical operations centers in fixed mount configurations.

[P5 / ESB SOF (BSO 24)]: Expeditionary Mobile Base Special Operations Forces (ESB SOF) - The SOF component requires an ESB (a type of boat) to have the capability for planning and conducting Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) for Boat Assault Force (BAF) and Helicopter Assault Force (HAF) missions.  These funds procure and install equipment to support SOF communications, consisting of a radio backbone infrastructure and increasing the bandwidth to support SOF missions.  These additional capabilities will be back fitted during ESB 4's Post Shakedown Availability.

[P3A / Battle Force Tactical Network]: Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN): This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. BFTN enables delivery of Internet Protocol (IP) based collaboration services over legacy High Frequency (HF) assets. The system provides an interoperable, low data rate, multi-node, Beyond-Line-of-Sight (BLOS) tactical edge networking capability using existing HF radio infrastructure. BFTN provides data path backbone for both airborne and afloat forces and increased data exchange with Allied Coalition forces. BFTN provides National, Allied, and Coalition maritime units with a medium band IP-based, tactical ship to ship at-sea networking capability, using legacy half-duplex Ultra High Frequency (UHF) Line-of-Sight and provides the only Allied Coalition HF/UHF Communications in a satellite denied/degraded situation. BFTN will provide a bridge between legacy radio systems and future emerging wideband networking technologies.

Justification.val:
The FY2020 funding request was reduced by $0.577 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

NU239 - PORT NSW: The FY20 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts. 

NU295 - Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN):  FY20 OPN funds the procurement of twelve (12) BFTN systems required to meet emerging communications threat environment. In addition, FY20 funds engineering changes to strengthen cyber security posture by implementing WIN 10 upgrades on previously fielded systems.

NU019 - EPLRS-DR/EMUT: FY20 funding procures and installs 8 Enhanced Position Location Reporting System - Data Radio (EPLRS-DR)/Enhanced Man-Pack UHF Tactical (EMUT). A complete unit consists of one AN/VRC-114(V)2 radio mount, one RF-5051PS power supply, and associated equipment.  The quantity procured in any given year is determined by the Fleet's demand signal and platform availability. 

NU385 - FY20 funding is for the installation of the remaining components to provide Special Operations Forces (SOF) capability on Expeditionary Mobile Base (ESB) 4. These funds will procure one Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP), one UHF SATCOM antenna, two HF antennas, one UHF/VHF System, two VHF Lo Antenna, two VHF Hi antennas and two UHF antennas.  

The cost delta between ESB 3 and ESB 4 are for the refurbished CBSP asset (ESB 3) vs new system (ESB 4) and the difference in labor rates (East Coast vs West Coast) for the Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) Efforts.

NU790 - Navy Expeditionary FY20 funding is for procurement of service-common support communications and Automated Data Processing (ADP) equipment in the approved Table of Allowances (TOA) equipment list. This equipment directly supports forward deployed special operations forces with real-time, actionable, time-sensitive transmission and reception of mission orders, intelligence, action and engagement status reporting, imaging, and target specification simultaneously in multiple theaters throughout the world. Investment in communications equipment, to include portable hand held radios, man pack radios, secure satellite telephones, UAV communications devices, ruggedized laptops, and encryption-decryption devices essential to the readiness and battlefield effectiveness of Naval Special Warfare (NSW) forces in winning the current fight against ISIS and other extremist elements. Additionally, it ensures the warfighter is optimally equipped with cutting edge communications equipment for the future fight and in compliance with crypto modernization directives found in CJCSI 6510.02E.

Funding increase for FY20 due to increased requirements in support of Expeditionary Mine Countermeasures (ExMCM) equipment procurements, production and fielding efforts.

Name.@footnote: Funding in FY20 includes procurement and installation for Enhanced Position Location reporting System - Data Radio (EPLRS-DR), Enhanced Man-Pack UHF Tactical (EMUT) MUOS antennas, and Landing Force Iridium to meet Marine Embarked Units (MEU) to support HF/UHF communications between the Landing Force Operations Center (LFOC) and Marines ashore to ensure interoperability between the Navy and Marine Corps.   The quantity procured and installed (in any given year) is determined by the fleet's demand signal and platform availability and leverages the ISEA to combine installs.

Quantities are not provided since thousands of various communications and Automated Data Processing equipment is being procured in support of correcting Table of Allowances (TOA) equipment shortfalls and bring NSW forces into alignment with required SOCOM and USN outfitting standards.  Funding increase for FY20 due to additional requirements in support of procurements, engineering integration and fielding efforts for common-service communications and Automated Data Processing (ADP) equipment identified in the approved Table of Allowances (TOA) equipment list. This equipment directly supports forward deployed special operations forces with real-time, actionable, time-sensitive transmission and reception of mission orders, intelligence, action and engagement status reporting, imaging, and target specification simultaneously in multiple theaters throughout the world.   Equipment provided is mission specific and can range from a portable hand held radio to a large scale communication system such as the Navy Enterprise Tactical Command and Control System. This funding provides Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) Tactical Radio Communications, equipment for 5,000+ C4I Vehicle Integration efforts include integrating communication systems, tactical radio installation, family of computer systems as required by specific mission.  Additionally, equipment to support Expeditionary Surveillance Command and Control, this can include basic generators and trailer platforms to high tech surveillance cameras.  Communication equipment is also procured for small craft C4I Integration on 300+ boats.
NU239 - PORT NSW: The FY20 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts.

Quantities are not provided since various equipment is being procured to provide Special Operations Forces (SOF) capability on Expeditionary Mobile Base (ESB) 4. Cost increase is to procure remaining SOF components to include several VHF and UHF antennas to be installed during the boats Post Shakedown Availability.
The installations costs are being broken out for transparency. The last time an installation occurred was in FY16. In FY 16 the installation cost (for ESB 3) were included in the recurring cost.
NU555 - PORT NSW Production Support: The FY20 budget request has been combined with NU790 to streamline acquisition efforts.

Consolidated prior years for PORT RAD - Hand Held Procurement, Hydra Procurement, NAVSEA HYDRA Requirement, DAMA IW Procurement, Hydra Installations FMP, HF SAR Installations FMP, and Navy Expeditionary C4I Production Support

DSA estimates are based off a percentage of the total installation cost with 75% of costs being required the year prior for installation design work and 25% required the year of the actual installation.  The DSA cost variance is due to ship configuration being installed.  The DSA increase from FY 2019 - FY 2020 is a result of the increase in the number of installations planned: 12 installations in FY 2020 to 34 installations in FY 2021.

As a result of realized Production Lead Time (PLT) associated with FY19 BFTN requirements, PLT changed to (9) nine months from (4) four months. In this request, planned FY19 procurements increased and their installation was deferred to FY20 due to the PLT change. As a result of the FY 19 procurement change, FY 20 units were reduced and budget realigned to support the installation of the increased FY 19 units.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: BFTN System Procurement

Description.val: This system is formally specified by both Fleet Commanders as a threshold capability for global maritime command control and communications in a Distributed Maritime Environment to execute current warfighting plans. Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN) is the Navy's near-term solution to Resilient Command and Control (RC2) communications in a satellite denied/degraded environment. Funding in FY2020 is for the procurement of twelve (12) Battle Force Tactical Network (BFTN) systems required to meet the emerging communications threat environment. In addition, funding in FY2020 is for engineering changes required to strengthen cyber security posture by implementing WIN 10 upgrades on previously fielded BFTN systems.
